meanings.definition: The basic monetary unit of Croatia.
meanings.sent1: In Croatia, you can buy many things with just one kuna.
meanings.sent2: I exchanged my euros for kuna before my trip to Croatia.
meanings.sent3: Why did the penny go to school? To learn how to become a kuna!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a shiny kuna, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The kuna in my pocket jingled happily as I walked.

meanings.definition: A member of an indigenous people of Panama and Colombia.
meanings.sent1: The kuna people have a rich cultural heritage.
meanings.sent2: I read a fascinating article about the kuna tribe.
meanings.sent3: Why did the kuna bring a ladder to the bar? To raise the roof!
meanings.sent4: She danced with the grace and rhythm of a kuna warrior.
meanings.sent5: The kuna elder shared stories by the fire, captivating the listeners.

meanings.definition: A traditional unit of length in Japan, equal to about 30.3 centimeters.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter measured the wood using a kuna.
meanings.sent2: The fabric was sold by the kuna in the market.
meanings.sent3: Why did the tailor use a kuna to measure? Because it was a cut above the rest!
meanings.sent4: The distance seemed like a kuna away, just within reach.
meanings.sent5: She cut the paper with precision, each piece exactly one kuna long.
